Explanation: The file in question is classified as benign, primarily due to its clear association with Microsoft as a legitimate Windows operating system component, indicated by the signature details and known distributor information. All 71 antivirus engines used in the analysis process detected no malicious activities, confirming its harmless status. Furthermore, sandbox verdicts from DAS-Security Orcas also categorize the file as clean. There are no indicators of malicious behaviors such as communication with command-and-control servers, persistence mechanisms, or suspicious URLs, supporting its classification as non-malicious software.
